id: Product Requirement Document - Free Notion Template
name: Product Requirement Document - Free Notion Template

enhancedContent.overview: The Product Requirement Document (PRD) template provides product managers and teams with a structured framework for defining and documenting product features, specifications, and requirements. This free Notion template streamlines the PRD creation process by offering pre-built sections that guide you through articulating product vision, user stories, technical requirements, and success metrics. Whether you're launching a new feature or building an entire product from scratch, this template ensures nothing falls through the cracks during the planning phase.

features: Pre-formatted sections for product overview and objectives
User stories and use case documentation areas
Success metrics and KPI tracking fields
Comment and feedback sections for stakeholder input
Shareable template for cross-functional team alignment
Database views for organizing multiple PRDs
Problem statement and solution definition areas

problemsSolved: Inconsistent product documentation across teams leading to misaligned expectations and wasted development effort
Missing critical requirements during planning that cause expensive rework later in the development cycle
Difficulty getting stakeholder buy-in due to unclear product vision and poorly articulated value propositions
Scattered product information across emails, docs, and meetings making it hard to maintain a single source of truth
solutionsBenefits: Provides a standardized PRD format that ensures consistent, comprehensive documentation across all product initiatives
Guides users through essential requirement categories with structured prompts, reducing the risk of overlooking important details
Creates a clear, shareable document that aligns stakeholders on product vision, scope, and success criteria before development begins
Centralizes all product planning information in Notion where it can be easily updated, referenced, and linked to related project documentation
idealFor: Product managers creating feature specifications or new product documentation from scratch
Startup founders who need to clearly define product requirements for their development teams
Engineering leads who want structured product specs to guide technical implementation
Product teams transitioning to Notion and seeking a professional PRD starting point
notRecommendedFor: Teams that already have established PRD templates in other tools and aren't migrating to Notion
Projects that require highly specialized or industry-specific requirement formats not covered by a general template

faqs.question: How do I get started with this template?
faqs.answer: After duplicating the template to your Notion workspace, start by filling out the product overview section with your product's core information. Then work through each section sequentially, customizing the structure as needed for your specific product. The template provides guidance on what to include in each area.

faqs.question: What's included in this template?
faqs.answer: The template includes structured sections for product vision, user stories, technical requirements, success metrics, competitive analysis, timeline planning, and risk assessment. It provides a complete framework for documenting all aspects of a product requirement.

faqs.question: Can I customize this template?
faqs.answer: Yes, the template is fully customizable within Notion. You can add, remove, or modify sections to match your team's specific documentation needs, integrate it with other Notion databases, and adapt the structure for different types of products or features.

faqs.question: What are the main use cases?
faqs.answer: Primary use cases include documenting new product launches, defining feature specifications for development sprints, creating alignment documents for stakeholder review, and maintaining a living reference for product requirements that evolves as the product develops.
